title: The Best Carry-On Travel Bag Is Nearly 80 Years Old
sub_head: L.L. Bean’s iconic ‘Boat and Tote’ tote has survived the test of time—and countless airline bins
body:
For the Baggage Claim series, seasoned travelers unpack their devotion to a favorite piece of luggage or travel accessory.
WHEN THE ancestor of this thick cotton canvas bag first appeared in the L.L. Bean catalog in 1944, it was called the Ice Carrier, marketed to “those who have found difficulty in carrying ice from car to ice chest.” It launched again in 1965 in a trimmer form and with a sunnier disposition, rebranded as the “Boat and Tote”; it now sported colored handles and came in various sizes and colors.
